documents.title: anglia square regeneration : 'a great idea '
text: ambitious plans which could see anglia square bulldozed and replaced with a mix of housing , retail and commercial developments are being welcome by traders in the north of norwich .

the magdalen street and anglia square traders association represents 30 businesses in the area , and spokesman jake wade says `` a big development will do nothing but help the area the place is falling into disrepair and needs overhauling '' .
i do n't think you could use this entire area just for retail , i do n't think there 's a call for it but there 's a call for many homes and i think it 's a great idea . ''

documents.title: boost needed for north of city , says councillor
text: plans for the redevelopment of norwich 's anglia square with more than 1,000 homes are to be discussed by the city council this afternoon .
the site is partially vacant , with buildings in some state of decline .
the seven storey sovereign house has stood empty since hmso pulled out in the late 1990s .
another office block , gildengate house , is only temporarily occupied by artists .
bert bremner , the labour councillor reponsible for the area , says the north of norwich `` needs a boost '' .

speaking to bbc radio norfolk 's nick conrad he said : `` if the office blocks were still full of workers , the place would be buzzing , but it is n't this development will make a big difference to the north of the city . ''
it 's not aiming to compete with the city centre it 's going to provide positive things and if it becomes a night-time economy with shops , cafes - that 's brilliant . ''

documents.title: regeneration plans for city shopping centre
text: plans worth hundreds of millions of pounds are being proposed to transform a shopping centre to the north of norwich .
anglia square and its car park , as well as the former hmso building sovereign house , would be bulldozed to make way for a mix of housing and commercial space .
it 's the third time in the last 10 years plans have been put forward to transform the 1960s complex , which lies to the north of the city between magdalen street and st augustine 's street .
bob weston , of weston homes , says their proposals include affordable homes plus houses for rent and retail facilities .
there 'll be new shops , restaurants , cafes and a new cinema we want to join anglia square to the town centre which at the moment is separated by the bypass . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'safe ' church stripped by lead thieves
text: st margaret 's church sits in the middle of the south norfolk village of hempnall , surrounded by homes .
because of its position , churchwarden claire key says they were always hopeful it would be safe from thieves .
but now the church has become the latest victim of lead theft .
three tonnes have been stripped from the roof of the north aisle , sometime between 19:00 on friday and 07:00 the following morning .
the 30m x 10m ( 32 x 10 yds ) section is likely to be worth £ 10,000 .
mrs key says there are tyre tracks in the churchyard made by the vehicle used to take the lead away , and wheelbarrow marks where the thieves transferred the lead from the church roof to the van .
a craft fair due to be held in the church this weekend will now have to be held in the village hall , as the church is not water-tight .
we want to use the church for the village and our parishioners so services will continue we will try our best to work around the piece that 's had to be cleared because of water damage . ''
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: slippery railway lines explained
text: social media has been awash with confused passengers today , wondering why their commute to work was delayed by `` slippery rails '' .
well network rail says each autumn leaves fall on to the railway lines and are compressed by passing trains .

`` the leaves create a thin , teflon-like layer on the rails , so train drivers have to brake earlier when approaching stations and signals to avoid overshooting and accelerate more gently to avoid wheel spin . ''
`` to maintain safety , longer gaps must be left between trains , leading to delays , '' a spokesman said .
there are still delays on greater anglia services afternoon .
author: Jack Warren
BBC Local Live

documents.title: multiple stab wound victim named by police
text: a post-mortem examination has confirmed that a man who was found fatally injured in norwich at the weekend died of a stab wound to the chest .
norfolk police have formally identified the victim as steven stannard , 37 , of bowers avenue .
officers were called to the street shortly after 14:30 on saturday .
the home office pathologist found he had multiple stab wounds .
a man in his 20s is still in custody having been arrested as part of the murder inquiry .
author: Andrew Woodger
BBC News

documents.title: 'chaotic ' vote for norfolk to stay in devo talks with suffolk
text: an extraordinary meeting has taken place at county hall in norwich , where councillors discussed the future of devolution .
at times there were chaotic scenes as councillors argued with each other - and at one stage the meeting had to be suspended .
norfolk county council has voted to stay in devolution talks , which keeps the dream of devolution with suffolk alive for a bit longer at least .
but the council only allowed the talks to continue after an amendment was put telling the government that there are substantial reservations about governance aspects of devolution .
councillors from all parties lined up to attack the idea of an elected mayor , and they also questioned how much of the money on offer from the government is actually new .
supporters of devolution say it 'll give local people more of a say in decision making and spending , and boost the economy of the region .
but today their voices were very quiet .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: your photos of autumn foliage
text: the wild and windy weather did its best to strip most of the leaves from the trees at the weekend , but our bbc weather watchers still managed to capture our woodland in its autumnal colours .

documents.title: devolution debate continues
text: an extraordinary meeting to decide whether norfolk county council should continue to take part in devolution talks descended into farce this morning as councillors lined up to attack the deal and argue with each other .
at one stage the session had to be suspended as officers tried to work out if new amendments could be put to the meeting and if an early vote could be taken .

the managing director of the council wendy thomson told the meeting that the offer from the government , which would come with extra powers and funding , was `` the most ambitious deal being proposed '' .
but councillors from all parties questioned how much of the money on offer was new and raised objections to being made to have an elected mayor .
the debate is continuing .
if councillors at norfolk county council eventually vote against the proposal , it would mean the joint devolution plan for norfolk and suffolk collapses .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

text: defiant neil aims to haul city out of championship tailspin - the back page of today 's eastern daily press :
author: Eastern Daily Press

text: latest figures reveal worrying gulf in ambulance response times across our region - today 's front page of the eastern daily press :
author: Eastern Daily Press

documents.title: 'no vote ' on devolution
text: no vote yet on devolution at norfolk county council .
it 's been decided we must have a full debate !

documents.title: devolution meeting descends 'into farce '
text: the meeting has now broken up for five minutes while officers try to work out if there can be a vote on devolution or if they must have a further debate .
andrew sinclair , bbc east political correspondent , tweeted : `` norfolk devo descends into farce as councillors argue whether or not they should hold a vote . ''
norfolk devo decends into farce as councillors argue whether or not they should hold a vote

documents.title: devolution meeting : heading for a vote
text: after nearly two hours of arguing norfolk county council appears to be heading for a vote on whether to continue in devolution talks .

documents.title: meeting yet to hear from anyone in favour of devolution
text: east political correspondent andrew sinclair is at the norfolk county council meeting which could decide the future of plans for devolution for norfolk and suffolk .
he 's just tweeted that it has been going for 90 minutes - but he has n't yet heard a single councillor speak in favour .

the meeting was told that people in breckland , norwich , great yarmouth and north norfolk will not get to vote in mayoral elections as the district councils in those areas have said no to the devolution proposal .
norfolk county council 's managing director wendy thomson said : `` there is no plan b if we say no to devolution . ''

documents.title: two bikes , worth more than £ 12,000 , stolen
text: norfolk police are investigating after two high value bikes worth more than £ 12,000 were stolen in poringland .
a multi-coloured specialised mountain bike and a grey santa cruz mountain bike were taken from a property in cawstons meadow between 10:00 on sunday , 30 october and 18:00 on thursday , 3 november .
anyone who may have seen sus activity in the area , or who has information , is asked to contact norfolk police on 101 or crimestoppers 0800 555111 .

documents.title: 'fractious start ' for devolution discussions
text: an extraordinary meeting at norfolk county council to discuss the future of devolution has got off to a. fractious start with some councillors questioning some of the promises being made by the government .
several have asked how the promise of £ 25m a year for the next 30 years for infrastructure can be kept as future governments may change their mind .
but the authority 's managing director wendy thomson told them that deal on offer was `` ambitious '' and that the government would in future give extra funding to areas which have mayors .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: `` grasp opportunity of devolution '' - sajid javid
text: local government secretary sajid javid has appealed to supporters of devolution in norfolk to `` hold firm and grasp an amazing opportunity to create jobs and prosperity in norfolk and suffolk '' .

in a letter made public ahead of today 's meeting at norfolk 's county hall , he says devolution would have a major impact on people 's lives but he insists that a mayor to oversee the new powers and money is a necessary requirement .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: crunch devolution meeting for norfolk and suffolk
text: an extraordinary meeting is taking place at norfolk county council this morning which could determine the future of plans for devolution for norfolk and suffolk .
the council leader , cliff jordan , is asking councillors if he should continue in the talks process now that four out of seven district authorities in the county have decided to pull out .
under the plans norfolk and suffolk would get extra powers from whitehall and receive millions of pounds for housing and infrastructure .
but the government 's insistence that the two counties have a directly-elected mayor to oversee the new powers has worried many councillors in norfolk .
if the county council decided to walk away from the talks , that would be the end of the plans .
author: Andrew Sinclair
BBC Look East political correspondent

documents.title: thousands of patients records missing for several months
text: a bbc investigation has found more than 9,000 patient records are missing from gp surgeries in norfolk , suffolk and essex .
the paper records are supposed to be transferred when a patient moves practice - a process which should take six weeks .
but 40 practices have told us they 've been waiting for records for more than six months .
some gps say there 's a risk it could affect patient care as they do n't have a patient 's full history .
capita , which took on the contract to deliver records from one surgery to another in march , accepts there have been teething problems .
it says an average record is delivered within three to six weeks , and does n't accept the claims of thousands of records being missing .
nhs england is ensuring the company takes urgent steps to improve services .
author: Nikki Fox
BBC Look East

documents.title: hockey : magpies into top three after away win
text: harleston magpies continued their promising start to the season with a 2-1 win at chelmsford .
maria andrews scored both goals to put the norfolk side 2-0 up , the second coming from a penalty corner .
the result means magpies are third in conference east having won four of their seven league matches so far this season .
they host league leaders sevenoaks on sunday in their next game .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: neil retains backing of norwich city board
text: norwich city manager alex neil appears to have the backing of the carrow road board despite their poor run of form .
joint majority shareholder delia smith gave an interview at the weekend to the times saying that she was `` 100 % behind '' the manager .
chief executive jez moxey spoke to bbc radio norfolk just before saturday 's 3-2 defeat by leeds which extended the canaries ' winless run to five matches .
`` there 'll be no additional pressure from us we are totally supportive of alex , we think he 's doing a great job . ''
said mr moxey .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport

documents.title: man arrested on sus of murder
text: a man is being questioned by police following a suspected murder at a house in norwich .
police officers were called to bowers avenue in hellesdon shortly after 14:30 on saturday , following reports of someone needing medical assistance .
a man in his 30s was found with serious injuries and died at the scene .
a man in his 20s has been arrested on sus of murder .
he 's in custody .
a cordon remains in place around the property .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : another cold and breezy day
text: another breezy and cold day , with north to north easterly winds and showers mixed in .
the showers will move further south through parts of suffolk and essex - with one or two feeding in from the wash later .
winds gradually easing , with sunny spells as the maximum temperature ranges between 5 and 9c ( 41f-48f ) .
watch my full regional forecast here :
weather has more details .
author: Kate Kinsella
BBC Look East weather

documents.title: good morning from norfolk live
text: hello from the norfolk live team - we hope you had a good weekend .
we 're here throughout the day with news , sport , travel and weather updates for the county .
norwich city lost 3-2 at home to leeds united at the weekend - manager alex neil vows to fight on , with chief executive jez moxey saying the board 's `` totally supportive '' of neil .
the weather forecast follows shortly , but we 'll start with this photo of the fireworks in norwich on friday evening .
author: Caroline Kingdon
BBC Local Live

documents.title: norwich manager vows to fight on after latest defeat
text: alex neil insists he is the man to turn round norwich city 's form as the pressure on his position increases .
the canaries lost 3-2 at home to leeds united on saturday .
it leaves them without a win in five games and fifth in the championship , ten points behind leaders newcastle , having been top of the table three weeks ago .
struggling nottingham forest and bottom club rotherham are the only teams to have conceded more goals than norwich in league this season .
alex neil told me on bbc radio norfolk after the leeds defeat that he will fight on in the job .
`` this run is n't acceptable and we need to do better .
it 's my responsibility , i 'll take the criticism that comes my way and i 'll work ever so hard to turn it round , '' he said .
author: Chris Goreham
BBC Radio Norfolk sport
